Package org.spongepowered.api.event

Interface EventManager

public interface EventManager
Manages the registration of event listeners and the dispatching of events.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type

    Registers Event methods annotated with @Listener in the specified object.

  • Method Details

    • registerListeners

      void registerListeners​(org.spongepowered.plugin.PluginContainer plugin, Object obj)
      Registers Event methods annotated with @Listener in the specified object.

      This will not include any methods declared in supertypes, but will test for private and package-private listener methods.

      Parameters:
      plugin - The plugin container
      obj - The object

    • registerListener

      <T extends Event> void registerListener​(org.spongepowered.plugin.PluginContainer plugin, Class<T> eventClass, EventListener<? super T> listener)
      Registers an event listener for a specific event class.

      Normally, the annotation-based way in registerListeners(PluginContainer, Object) should be preferred over this way. This method exists primarily to support dynamic event registration like needed in scripting plugins.

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the event
      Parameters:
      plugin - The plugin instance
      eventClass - The event to listen to
      listener - The listener to receive the events

    • registerListener

      <T extends Event> void registerListener​(org.spongepowered.plugin.PluginContainer plugin, io.leangen.geantyref.TypeToken<T> eventType, EventListener<? super T> listener)
      Registers an event listener for a specific event TypeToken.

      Normally, the annotation-based way in registerListeners(PluginContainer, Object) should be preferred over this way. This method exists primarily to support dynamic event registration like needed in scripting plugins.

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the event
      Parameters:
      plugin - The plugin instance
      eventType - The event to listen to
      listener - The listener to receive the events

    • registerListener

      <T extends Event> void registerListener​(org.spongepowered.plugin.PluginContainer plugin, Class<T> eventClass, Order order, EventListener<? super T> listener)
      Registers an event listener with the specified order for a specific event class.

      Normally, the annotation-based way in registerListeners(PluginContainer, Object) should be preferred over this way. This method exists primarily to support dynamic event registration like needed in scripting plugins.

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the event
      Parameters:
      plugin - The plugin instance
      eventClass - The event to listen to
      order - The order the listener will get called at
      listener - The listener to receive the events

    • registerListener

      <T extends Event> void registerListener​(org.spongepowered.plugin.PluginContainer plugin, io.leangen.geantyref.TypeToken<T> eventType, Order order, EventListener<? super T> listener)
      Registers an event listener with the specified order for a specific event TypeToken.

      Normally, the annotation-based way in registerListeners(PluginContainer, Object) should be preferred over this way. This method exists primarily to support dynamic event registration like needed in scripting plugins.

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the event
      Parameters:
      plugin - The plugin instance
      eventType - The event to listen to
      order - The order the listener will get called at
      listener - The listener to receive the events

    • registerListener

      <T extends Event> void registerListener​(org.spongepowered.plugin.PluginContainer plugin, Class<T> eventClass, Order order, boolean beforeModifications, EventListener<? super T> listener)
      Registers an event listener with the specified order for a specific event class.

      Normally, the annotation-based way in registerListeners(PluginContainer, Object) should be preferred over this way. This method exists primarily to support dynamic event registration like needed in scripting plugins.

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the event
      Parameters:
      plugin - The plugin instance
      eventClass - The event to listen to
      order - The order the listener will get called at
      beforeModifications - Whether to call the listener before other server modifications
      listener - The listener to receive the events

    • registerListener

      <T extends Event> void registerListener​(org.spongepowered.plugin.PluginContainer plugin, io.leangen.geantyref.TypeToken<T> eventType, Order order, boolean beforeModifications, EventListener<? super T> listener)
      Registers an event listener with the specified order for a specific event class.

      Normally, the annotation-based way in registerListeners(PluginContainer, Object) should be preferred over this way. This method exists primarily to support dynamic event registration like needed in scripting plugins.

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the event
      Parameters:
      plugin - The plugin instance
      eventType - The event to listen to
      order - The order the listener will get called at
      beforeModifications - Whether to call the listener before other server modifications
      listener - The listener to receive the events

    • unregisterListeners

      void unregisterListeners​(Object obj)
      Un-registers an object from receiving Events.
      Parameters:
      obj - The object

    • unregisterPluginListeners

      void unregisterPluginListeners​(org.spongepowered.plugin.PluginContainer plugin)
      Un-registers all event listeners of a plugin.
      Parameters:
      plugin - The plugin instance

    • post

      boolean post​(Event event)
      Calls a Event to all listeners that listen to it.
      Parameters:
      event - The event
      Returns:
      True if cancelled, false if not
